# Draft:Battle of Donggyeongseong

The first Battle of Donggyeongseong(한국어:동경성 전투)  was a battle between the Korean Independence Army and the Imperial Japanese Army. The battle resulted in a Korean tactical victory, forcing the Japanese to retreat.
Background
The Korean Independence Army lead by Hong Beom-do won many battles including the battles of Samdumja, Fengwudong, and Qinshanli. The Korean Independence Army, feeling confident in their capabilities to defeat the Japanese, decided to attack them at Donggyeongseong.
The Battle
The Korean Independence Army along with the Korean Northern Army Command attacked the Imperial Japanese Army using guerilla warfare. They successfully forced the Japanese to retreat from Donggyeongseong after inflicting heavy casualties.
Casualties of the battle
The Korean Independence Army suffered around 50-100 killed and wounded. Although disputed, it is likely that the Japanese suffered around 100-300 killed and wounded.
Aftermath
Although achieving a tactical victory in forcing the Japanese to retreat, the Koreans could not manage to keep control of the territory that they captured. The Japanese retaliated on the Koreans by initiating the Gando Massacre, in which at least 5,000 Koreans living in China were killed.
